title: Exposing the Massive Fraud & Political Corruption in Minnesota and California
summary:
Exposing the Massive Fraud & Political Corruption in Minnesota and California

In this episode, we delve into the staggering fraud and corruption that has taken hold in Minnesota and California. We examine how dozens of individuals, predominantly from the East African and Somali communities, have been convicted of stealing over a billion dollars from taxpayer-funded programs during the COVID-19 pandemic. Governor Tim Walz's administration is under scrutiny for its failure to address this, allegedly due to fears of losing political support. We also explore similar issues in California, where illegal immigrants have fraudulently obtained commercial driver's licenses, leading to deadly accidents. This episode highlights the broader impacts of mass immigration and inadequate assimilation on the rule of law in the United States. 00:00 Massive COVID-19 Fraud in Minnesota 00:25 Governor's Response and Accountability 01:24 Political Implications and Media Coverage 02:13 Details of the Fraud Scandal 05:31 Broader Issues of Immigration and Multiculturalism 07:46 Specific Cases of Fraud and Corruption 19:50 Illegal Immigrants and Fraudulent Licenses 35:00 Conclusion and Final Thoughts

title: Sales Tax Exemption for Bunker Fuel
summary: Chapter 442 of 2023 (AB 543, Gipson) extended a longstanding sales tax exemption for certain purchases of bunker fuel, also known as maritime fuel. The law directs our office to submit an annual report containing data on three outcomes: the average monthly maritime fuel price at all domestic and international Pacific seaports, the average monthly maritime fuel price at California seaports, and maritime fuel deliveries at California seaports. This report fulfills that statutory requirement.

title: The 2026-27 Budget: California's Fiscal Outlook
summary: Each year, our office publishes the Fiscal Outlook in anticipation of the upcoming budget season. This report gives the Legislature our independent estimates and analysis of the state’s General Fund budget condition with the goal of helping lawmakers prepare for the 2026-27 budget process. As always, our Fiscal Outlook evaluates the budget’s condition based on current law and policy both at the state and federal level.

title: The 2026-27 Budget: Fiscal Outlook for Schools and Community Colleges
summary: We forecast that increases to the Proposition 98 guarantee in 2024-25 and 2025-26, coupled with a preexisting payment obligation, require the state to provide nearly $7.4 billion in one-time funds for schools and community colleges. For 2026-27, we estimate the guarantee is $117.8 billion, an increase of $3.2 billion (2.8 percent) from the previously enacted level. This growth—combined with a required reserve withdrawal—would be just enough to fund a 2.51 percent statutory cost-of-living adjustment (COLA). The state could use the one-time funds to build budget resiliency, which seems especially important given the risks of a stock market downturn.

title: Statewide Survey: Californians and Their Economic Well-Being

title: From Protection to Prosecution: The New Face of DOJ
summary:
Federal Government Focus: School Board Controversy & FBI Achievements

Do you remember the controversy over the federal government's intervention in school board meetings? This episode delves into the Department of Justice's priorities under Merrick Garland and the involvement of the National Security Division in parental disagreements at school boards. Additionally, we highlight the FBI's achievements in combating violent crime, seizing illegal firearms and drugs, and arresting top criminals during the Trump administration. Is this the best use of federal resources? Should local or state law enforcement handle such issues? Discover the contrasting focuses and effectiveness between administrations.

title: CADEM Ramps Up Voter Protection Efforts Ahead of November 2025 Election
summary:
SACRAMENTO, CA — Today the California Democratic Party (CADEM) announced expanded voter protection efforts across the state leading up to the Special Election on November 4, 2025 to ensure voters have access to trusted information, legal support, and on-the-ground assistance from trained volunteers at every step of the voting process.  Since 1992, the California Democratic Party’s […]

The post CADEM Ramps Up Voter Protection Efforts Ahead of November 2025 Election appeared first on California Democratic Party.

title: Beyond Wokeness: A Call for True Leadership in Law Enforcement and Politics
summary:
Beyond Wokeness: A Call for True Leadership in Law Enforcement and Politics

With special guest Marc Gomez (Retired Sergeant CHP) we dive into the current state of leadership and its challenges. From the Attorney General candidate Jay Jones' scandal in Virginia to the controversial decision by Chicago PD's Chief of Patrol, we explore how politics influence critical decisions. We also examine Secretary of War Pete Hegseth's bold statements on restoring military standards and how this contrasts with the perceived lack of leadership in places like Chicago. How is leadership shaping the future of our institutions? Can we navigate through political influence to uphold professionalism and safety? Join the discussion and get the facts.

title: ABC7: California retired veterans and families to benefit from new military pension tax exemption
summary: REDLANDS, Calif. (KABC) — Veterans have served and sacrificed for our nation, and on Tuesday, the state of California announced a new law to help them in retirement. That law will exempt part of their military pensions from state income tax. At American Legion Post 106 in Redlands, Assemblymember James Ramos (D-San Bernardino) stood before retired […]

title: Thunderstruck: Marines compete in first-ever service-wide communications team competition
summary: U.S. Marines from across the globe competed in the inaugural Thunderstruck Communications Team Competition, hosted by Marine Wing Communications Squadron 38, Marine Air Control Group 38, 3rd Marine Aircraft Wing Sept. 10, 2025.
